alert.note: Alert for Dubuque; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 12:33PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Jackson, Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Dubuque. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Water affects yards in the East Dubuque Shore Acres subdivision. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to 21.2 feet Monday morning. Additional rises are are expected until at least the last week of April. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
